trans-unit.source: Configure RBS for the StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure RBS for the StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to install the StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint in a SharePoint server farm.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to install the StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint in a SharePoint server farm.

trans-unit.source: When making changes to the StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint RBS configuration, you must be logged on with a user account that belongs to the Domain Admins group.
trans-unit.target: When making changes to the StorSimple Adapter for SharePoint RBS configuration, you must be logged on with a user account that belongs to the Domain Admins group.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you must access the configuration page from a browser running on the same host as Central Administration.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you must access the configuration page from a browser running on the same host as Central Administration.

trans-unit.source: Open the SharePoint Central Administration page, and browse to System Settings.
trans-unit.target: Open the SharePoint Central Administration page, and browse to System Settings.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure StorSimple section, click Configure StorSimple Adapter.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure StorSimple section, click Configure StorSimple Adapter.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure the StorSimple Adapter</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure the StorSimple Adapter</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure StorSimple Adapter page:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure StorSimple Adapter page:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the Enable editing path check box is selected.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the Enable editing path check box is selected.

trans-unit.source: In the text box, type the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path of the BLOB store.
trans-unit.target: In the text box, type the Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path of the BLOB store.

trans-unit.source: The BLOB store volume must be hosted on an iSCSI volume configured on the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: The BLOB store volume must be hosted on an iSCSI volume configured on the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Click the Enable button below each of the content databases that you want to configure for remote storage.
trans-unit.target: Click the Enable button below each of the content databases that you want to configure for remote storage.

trans-unit.source: The BLOB store must be shared and reachable by all web front-end (WFE) servers, and the user account that is configured for the SharePoint server farm must have access to the share.
trans-unit.target: The BLOB store must be shared and reachable by all web front-end (WFE) servers, and the user account that is configured for the SharePoint server farm must have access to the share.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable the RBS provider</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable the RBS provider</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you enable or disable RBS, you will also see the following message.
trans-unit.target: When you enable or disable RBS, you will also see the following message.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure StorSimple Adapter Enable Disable</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure StorSimple Adapter Enable Disable</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Update button to apply the configuration.
trans-unit.target: Click the Update button to apply the configuration.

trans-unit.source: When you click the Update button, the RBS configuration status will be updated on all WFE servers, and the entire farm will be RBS-enabled.
trans-unit.target: When you click the Update button, the RBS configuration status will be updated on all WFE servers, and the entire farm will be RBS-enabled.

trans-unit.source: The following message appears.
trans-unit.target: The following message appears.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Adapter configuration message</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Adapter configuration message</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you are configuring RBS for a SharePoint farm with a very large number of databases (greater than 200), the SharePoint Central Administration web page might time out.
trans-unit.target: If you are configuring RBS for a SharePoint farm with a very large number of databases (greater than 200), the SharePoint Central Administration web page might time out.

trans-unit.source: If that occurs, refresh the page.
trans-unit.target: If that occurs, refresh the page.

trans-unit.source: This does not affect the configuration process.
trans-unit.target: This does not affect the configuration process.

trans-unit.source: Verify the configuration:
trans-unit.target: Verify the configuration:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the SharePoint Central Administration website, and browse to the Configure StorSimple Adapter page.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the SharePoint Central Administration website, and browse to the Configure StorSimple Adapter page.

trans-unit.source: Check the configuration details to make sure that they match the settings that you entered.
trans-unit.target: Check the configuration details to make sure that they match the settings that you entered.

trans-unit.source: Verify that RBS works correctly:
trans-unit.target: Verify that RBS works correctly:

trans-unit.source: Upload a document to SharePoint.
trans-unit.target: Upload a document to SharePoint.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the UNC path that you configured.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the UNC path that you configured.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the RBS directory structure was created and that it contains the uploaded object.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the RBS directory structure was created and that it contains the uploaded object.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) You can use the Microsoft RBS Migrate() PowerShell cmdlet included with SharePoint to migrate existing BLOB content to the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) You can use the Microsoft RBS Migrate() PowerShell cmdlet included with SharePoint to migrate existing BLOB content to the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Migrate content into or out of RBS in SharePoint 2013[6]</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Migrate content into or out of RBS (SharePoint Foundation 2010)[7]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Migrate content into or out of RBS in SharePoint 2013[6]</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Migrate content into or out of RBS (SharePoint Foundation 2010)[7]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) On test installations, you can verify that the BLOBs were moved out of the content database as follows:
trans-unit.target: (Optional) On test installations, you can verify that the BLOBs were moved out of the content database as follows:

trans-unit.source: Start SQL Management Studio.
trans-unit.target: Start SQL Management Studio.

trans-unit.source: Run the ListBlobsInDB2010.sql or ListBlobsInDB2013.sql query, as follows.
trans-unit.target: Run the ListBlobsInDB2010.sql or ListBlobsInDB2013.sql query, as follows.

trans-unit.source: ListBlobsInDB_2013.sql
trans-unit.target: ListBlobsInDB_2013.sql

trans-unit.source: USE WSS_Content GO
trans-unit.target: USE WSS_Content GO

trans-unit.source: SELECT DocStreams.DocId, LeafName AS Name, Content, AllDocs.Size AS OrigSizeOfContent, LEN(CAST(Content AS VARBINARY(MAX))) AS SizeOfContentInDB, DocStreams.RbsId, TimeLastModified
trans-unit.target: SELECT DocStreams.DocId, LeafName AS Name, Content, AllDocs.Size AS OrigSizeOfContent, LEN(CAST(Content AS VARBINARY(MAX))) AS SizeOfContentInDB, DocStreams.RbsId, TimeLastModified

trans-unit.source: FROM DocStreams INNER JOIN AllDocs ON DocStreams.DocId = AllDocs.Id ORDER BY TimeLastModified DESC GO
trans-unit.target: FROM DocStreams INNER JOIN AllDocs ON DocStreams.DocId = AllDocs.Id ORDER BY TimeLastModified DESC GO

trans-unit.source: ListBlobsInDB_2010.sql
trans-unit.target: ListBlobsInDB_2010.sql

trans-unit.source: USE WSS_Content GO
trans-unit.target: USE WSS_Content GO

trans-unit.source: SELECT AllDocStreams.Id, LeafName AS Name, Content, AllDocs.Size AS OrigSizeOfContent, LEN(CAST(Content AS VARBINARY(MAX))) AS SizeOfContentInDB, RbsId, TimeLastModified FROM AllDocStreams INNER JOIN AllDocs ON AllDocStreams.Id = AllDocs.Id ORDER BY TimeLastModified DESC GO
trans-unit.target: SELECT AllDocStreams.Id, LeafName AS Name, Content, AllDocs.Size AS OrigSizeOfContent, LEN(CAST(Content AS VARBINARY(MAX))) AS SizeOfContentInDB, RbsId, TimeLastModified FROM AllDocStreams INNER JOIN AllDocs ON AllDocStreams.Id = AllDocs.Id ORDER BY TimeLastModified DESC GO

trans-unit.source: If RBS was configured correctly, a NULL value should appear in the SizeOfContentInDB column for any object that was uploaded and successfully externalized with RBS.
trans-unit.target: If RBS was configured correctly, a NULL value should appear in the SizeOfContentInDB column for any object that was uploaded and successfully externalized with RBS.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) After you configure RBS and move all BLOB content to the StorSimple device, you can move the content database to the device.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) After you configure RBS and move all BLOB content to the StorSimple device, you can move the content database to the device.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to move the content database, we recommend that you configure the content database storage on the device as a primary volume.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to move the content database, we recommend that you configure the content database storage on the device as a primary volume.

trans-unit.source: Then, use established SQL Server best practices to migrate the content database to the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Then, use established SQL Server best practices to migrate the content database to the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: Moving the content database to the device is only supported for the StorSimple 8000 series (it is not supported for the 5000 or 7000 series).
trans-unit.target: Moving the content database to the device is only supported for the StorSimple 8000 series (it is not supported for the 5000 or 7000 series).

trans-unit.source: If you store BLOBs and the content database in separate volumes on the StorSimple device, we recommend that you configure them in the same volume container.
trans-unit.target: If you store BLOBs and the content database in separate volumes on the StorSimple device, we recommend that you configure them in the same volume container.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that they will be backed up together.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that they will be backed up together.

trans-unit.source: If you have not enabled RBS, we do not recommend moving the content database to the StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: If you have not enabled RBS, we do not recommend moving the content database to the StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: This is an untested configuration.
trans-unit.target: This is an untested configuration.

trans-unit.source: Go to the next step: <linkText>Configure garbage collection</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Go to the next step: <linkText>Configure garbage collection</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ff628254(v=office.15).aspx
trans-unit.target: https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ff628254(v=office.15).aspx

trans-unit.source: https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ff628255(v=office.14).aspx
trans-unit.target: https://technet.microsoft.com/library/ff628255(v=office.14).aspx
